## Step 1: Create Supabase Account

### 1a. Visit Supabase Website
- Open your browser
- Go to **https://supabase.com**
- You'll see the homepage with a big button that says "Start your project"

### 1b. Sign Up
- Click **"Sign Up"** (top right)
- Choose **"Continue with Email"**
- Enter your email address
- Create a password
- Click **"Sign Up"**
- Check your email for verification link
- Click the verification link

### 1c. Create Your First Project
After email verification, you'll see:
```
Welcome to Supabase!
[Create a new project] button
```
- Click **"Create a new project"**

### 1d. Project Details
Fill in:
```
Project Name: MSP Registration Database
(or any name you prefer)

Database Password: (create a strong password)
Region: Choose closest to Tanzania
(East Africa / Singapore / Europe)
```
- Click **"Create new project"**
- **Wait 1-2 minutes** for the project to be created
- You'll see "Initializing project..." â†’ then the dashboard opens

---

## Step 3: Create the Table in Supabase

### 3a. Go to SQL Editor
In your Supabase dashboard:
- Look at the left sidebar
- Click **"SQL Editor"** (or "SQL")

### 3b. Create New Query
- Click **"New Query"** or **"+"** button
- You'll see a blank text editor

### 3c. Copy & Paste SQL Code

**Go back to your MSP website** and visit: `/admin-setup`

On that page, you'll see a gray box with SQL code. 
- Click the **"ğŸ“‹ Copy SQL to Clipboard"** button
- (This copies the code automatically)

**Back in Supabase:**
- In the SQL editor, click in the text area
- Paste the code (Ctrl+V or Cmd+V)
- You should see something like:

```sql
CREATE TABLE msp_registrations (
  id BIGINT PRIMARY KEY GENERATED ALWAYS AS IDENTITY,
  name TEXT NOT NULL,
  email TEXT NOT NULL,
  ...
)
```

### 3d. Run the SQL
- Click the big **blue "Run" button** (top right of editor)
- Wait a few seconds
- You should see: **"Success"** message

---

## Step 4: Enter Credentials in Admin Setup Page

### 4a. Go to Admin Setup
On your MSP website:
- Visit: **`/admin-setup`**
- You'll see a form with two input fields

### 4b. Paste Project URL
- Click the first field: **"Supabase Project URL"**
- Paste the URL you copied (Ctrl+V)
- Example: `https://your-project-name.supabase.co`

### 4c. Paste API Key
- Click the second field: **"Supabase Anon Public Key"**
- Paste the API key you copied (Ctrl+V)
- Example: `eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...`

### 4d. Test Connection
- Click **"ğŸ§ª Test Connection"** button
- **Wait 5-10 seconds**
- You should see: **"âœ“ Successfully connected to Supabase!"**

If you see an error:
- âŒ **"Invalid API key"** â†’ Copy the API key again from Supabase
- âŒ **"Table not found"** â†’ Make sure you ran the SQL in step 3c
- âŒ **"Connection failed"** â†’ Check your Project URL is correct

### 4e. Save Configuration
- Once connection is successful, click **"âœ“ Save Configuration"**
- You'll see: **"âœ“ Configuration saved!"**
- The form will disappear and show a **green success message**
- This means **setup is complete!** âœ“

## Step 5: Test Registration

### 5a. Go to Events Page
- Visit: **`/events`**
- You'll see the workshop registration form

### 5b. Fill Out Test Registration
- Fill in all required fields:
  - Full Name: `Test User`
  - Email: `test@example.com`
  - Organization: `Test Org`
  - Role: `Test Role`
  - Gender: `Male` (or any option)
  - District/Region: `Test Region`
  - Experience: `Beginner` (or any option)
  - Interest: `Data Collection Methods` (or any option)

### 5c. Submit Form
- Click **"Register for Workshop"** button
- You should see a **green success message**: âœ“
- The form should clear

### 5d. Check Supabase Dashboard
- Go back to Supabase
- In left sidebar, click **"Table Editor"**
- Click **"msp_registrations"**
- You should see your test registration in the table!

## Important Notes

### Your Credentials Are Safe
- URL and API key are stored only in your browser's localStorage
- Never sent anywhere except directly to Supabase
- API key is "anon public" (read-only access for registrations)

### Access Your Data Anytime
To see registrations from anywhere:
1. Go to https://supabase.com
2. Log in with your email
3. Open your "MSP Registration Database" project
4. Click "Table Editor" â†’ "msp_registrations"
5. See all registrations in real-time!

### Export Data
In Supabase Table Editor:
- Click the menu (â‹®) next to table name
- Choose "Export" â†’ "Download as CSV"
- Get all registrations in a spreadsheet

---

## Troubleshooting

**Q: I forgot my Supabase password**
- Go to supabase.com â†’ "Forgot password"

**Q: Table doesn't appear in Supabase**
- Check that you ran the SQL code in SQL Editor
- Make sure you clicked the blue "Run" button

**Q: Connection test fails**
- Double-check Project URL is spelled correctly
- Double-check API key is complete (no missing characters)
- Make sure you created the table first

**Q: Registrations not appearing in Supabase**
- Test the registration form at `/events`
- Check browser console (F12 â†’ Console) for errors
- Make sure table is named exactly "msp_registrations"
